author: GSnoodePlannen
post_text: November 18, 2015 at 4:17â€¯PM#1I've made a macro to delete old, create and store new effects. Before the update I would start my macro, after a few lines it starts a second macro, which would run from first untill the last line, and after that the first macro would continue where it started.Commandline feedback looks like this:Go macro 1macro 1 line 1: ....macro 1 line 2 : go macro 2macro 2 line 1 : ....macro 2 line 2 : ....macro 2 line 3 : ....macro 2 line 4 : ....(end of macro 2)macro 1 line 3 : ....macro 1 line 4 : ....etc.After the update something changed with the timing, and I can't find the solution.Whenever I start the first macro, it starts like it should, but when it starts the second macro both macros run at the same time. Commandline feedback looks like this:Go macro 1macro 1 line 1 : ....macro 1 line 2 : go macro 2macro 2 line 1 : ....macro 1 line 3 : ....macro 2 line 2 : ....macro 1 line 4 : ...macro 2 line 3 : ....macro 1 line 5 : ....macro 2 line 4 : ....(end of macro 2)macro 1 line 6 : ....macro 1 line 7 : ....etc.Does anyone know how to solve this?
title: Macro f*ck up since update 3.1.2.5
